Title: ISC DHCP: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in ISC DHCP, the worst of
    which could allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: ISC DHCP is a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) client/server.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ISC DHCP. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: Remote attackers could execute arbitrary code, cause a Denial of Service condition, or have other unspecified impacts.

Workaround.Text:
There are no known workarounds at this time for CVE-2018-5732 or CVE-2018-5733.

In accordance with upstream documentation, the recommended workaround for CVE-2017-3144 is, “to disallow access to the OMAPI control port from unauthorized clients (in accordance with best practices for server operation).”

P.Text: All DHCP users should upgrade to the latest version:
